attributes.action: Siblings at the Same Primary School
attributes.additional_details:
We seek an amendment to the Admissions Code to ensure siblings have the right to be educated together.

The Suggested Criteria listed in the Admissions Code should become mandatory after SEN & children in care.

Currently it is not mandatory for Local Authorities to prioritise siblings on their admissions criteria.

Changes to the 2012 Admissions Code & increasing pressure on primary school places mean families are put in the distressing situation where young children are prevented from attending the same school.

At risk are:
- non SEN siblings of children with SEN who have gained a place at an out of catchment school
- families forced to accept an out of catchment/unplaced school for their eldest child (if their catchment school is oversubscribed), whose siblings will be ranked below children within catchment
- families who gained a place at an undersubscribed out-of-catchment school, whose siblings will not be entitled to a place once the school is oversubscribed
